string-array.name: helpQuestions_General
string-array.item: Note about Help and FAQ\'s
What is this?
What happens if my device malfunctions or gets bricked?
But can\'t I just use RootCloak?
How do we know your not storing our sensitive account information?
How come the some of the application preferences are disabled on my device?
What does the "Spoof Device" feature do when enabled for Semble and ANZ GoMoney?
Why spoof my current device to an old phone such as the Samsung Galaxy Note 3?
Its not working, who do I contact?
I have more questions and/or need your help getting it working?
Why do you keep updating the application so often?

string-array.name: helpAnswers_General
string-array.item: Although the information here is still relevant, it is also very limited simply because it cannot list all FAQ\'s, known issues and bugs. For more helpful and in-depth support, its recommended to read the XDA thread.

This is a Xposed module application which hooks on the ANZ GoMoney, Semble and TVNZ OnDemand to bypass certain root detection so users that have rooted and/or non-supported devices can use GoMoney Wallet, Semble services and watch OnDemand videos respectively.

As a rooted user I suspect you knew the risks. A disclaimer is placed on the XDA thread and Xposed Repository module page confirming that by using this application that I, ANZ, Semble, TVNZ and their partners will not be responsible for any worst case scenarios. To avoid bricking, do a full (nandroid) backup just in case anything happens. The likelihood of something happening is very slim, but don\'t take unnecessary chances.
USE AT YOUR OWN RISK, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

RootCloak rarely works for banking applications as the source code used is too generic to target all applications. In this specific case, RootCloak doesn't work properly with Semble or ANZ GoMoney NZ hence why this application was created.

I have no intention of doing that. If you are truly paranoid, the source code is available on GitHub which can be viewed on the main menu of this module. There you can see for yourself that there is no code storing bank information or sending it off to a remote server or anything like that.

If an option is disabled it means the application used for those tweaks is not installed. For instance, if I dont have any of the variants of Semble (either from Vodafone, 2Degrees of Spark), the option is disabled because it would provide no additional benefits of having it enabled.

This changes the way your device appears to ANZ GoMoney or the Semble application. You only need this enabled if your mobile phone is not on the ANZ GoMoney Wallet or Semble compatibility list but know your device has NFC with HCE support. This feature does not guarantee that NFC payment will work because there are some devices out there that simply will never work due to software or hardware restrictions. 

 The difference between this and other spoofing applications is this module does NOT modify 'build.prop' so it will only affect the ANZ GoMoney and Semble application, not the entire system which would be impractical. 

 If spoofing is enabled for ANZ GoMoney, you MUST clear all cache and data of the ANZ GoMoney application and re-login. So keep your Account Number and password handy. This is not necessary for Semble though.

There are several reasons why the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 was chosen as the display device for the spoofing feature. Firstly, its on the ANZ GoMoney Wallet and Semble compatibility list. Secondly, I own a Note 3 so I can confirm that GoMoney Wallet and Semble work completely on this device and it easy to get information out of a device you already own. Thirdly, as previously stated, it works completely. Other devices, such as the newer S6 and S5 range have issues even for people without rooted devices making them not an ideal candidate to use as the display device.

Depending on the issue, I might not always be the best person to contact. Semble and ANZ GoMoney Wallet are realtively new applications and still have bugs which is something out of my hands. If you have a payment issue, most likely contact the application provider or your bank for support. If you are having root detection problem or the module is not working then its best to contact me via XDA or email.

Cool! Im happy to help to answer more questions and help individuals. If you are experiencing a problem, please tell me a full description of problem otherwise I can\'t determine how to solve the problem. You can contact me via XDA or email. You can also contact me for feature requests as well.

For the most part, many of the upcoming updates will be for UI improvements, bug fixes, or adding new features. Other times, its because ANZ, Semble and TVNZ improve their root detection techniques so I have to find new workarounds in order for this module to work with newer application versions.

string-array.name: helpQuestions_ANZ
string-array.item: When toggling features for ANZ GoMoney, why do you always state I need to clear the cache and data of the ANZ GoMoney?

string-array.name: helpAnswers_ANZ
string-array.item: There is two reasons I tell you to do this. Firstly, the ANZ GoMoney Application has checks for root on boot as well as when you launch the application. When it detects root access, it disables all GoMoney Wallet features even if it was previously enabled. To re-activate these settings, the only way to do this is to reset application completely by clearing the cache and data. Another reason, which mainly applies mainly to the "Spoof Device" feature is that the application needs to be reset as device registration only happens on first-time run of the application hence why clearing cache and data is needed. \n\n When toggling the option to enable screenshots, you do not need to clear the data or cache. Next time you open the application, the setting you choose will be in place.
